statsguruLinks.title: Most wickets v Zimbabwe in ODIs

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah not out 82 (112b 6x4 0x6 178m) SR: 73.21

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim c Chigumbura b Kamungozi 77 (78b 7x4 0x6 107m) SR: 98.71

dismissalComment.html: top-edge and cover takes a dolly! Mushy cannot believe he has got out so softly. It was slower through the air and pitched on off to tempt a slog sweep. There was just enough turn to make the batsman miscue the shot and Zimbabwe have finally broken through

he's picked out deep point! Pressure talks. This was a fuller delivery outside off, Tamim spotted an opportunity for a flay over point. Manages to do so, but forgets all about the man in the deep. Hami M continues to be the thorn in Bangladesh's side

that's the big wicket, and its come off a slower ball! It was full, it was wide, it was tempting and Shakib could not help himself. Leaned into a booming drive and realises he was at the ball way too early. Scoops it up for short cover.
length on off stump and he has hoisted it straight up. It was the slower ball, and he had loaded up for the big shot far too early. Bat face turns in his hands and mid-on collects a simple catch

he's missed a straight ball! Caught in the crease against a fuller ball that was missing off and missing leg and hitting middle. Overestimates the angle into him and went for a flick, played all around it, and has to walk back

headshotImage.caption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Imrul Kayes player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: catch it, they cry, and Taylor has pulled off a stunner! Kayes goes for a flick and thinks he has nailed it, only to watch short midwicket move to his right, stick out a hand over his head and pluck it out of thin air

nicks off to the keeper and Zimbabwe will breathe a sigh of relief. it was a good length ball outside off and Mashrafe was looking to smoke it over cow corner. Ends up outside edging to Moor behind the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Anamul Haque lbw b Madziva 5 (12b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 41.66

dismissalComment.html: he's missed a straight ball! Caught in the crease against a fuller ball that was missing off and missing leg and hitting middle. Overestimates the angle into him and went for a flick, played all around it, and has to walk back

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Masakadza b Mire 16 (34b 2x4 0x6 46m) SR: 47.05

dismissalComment.html: he's picked out deep point! Pressure talks. This was a fuller delivery outside off, Tamim spotted an opportunity for a flay over point. Manages to do so, but forgets all about the man in the deep. Hami M continues to be the thorn in Bangladesh's side

dismissalText.commentary: Imrul Kayes c Taylor b Madziva 5 (18b 0x4 0x6 34m) SR: 27.77

dismissalComment.html: catch it, they cry, and Taylor has pulled off a stunner! Kayes goes for a flick and thinks he has nailed it, only to watch short midwicket move to his right, stick out a hand over his head and pluck it out of thin air

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan c Maruma b Mire 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 6m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: that's the big wicket, and its come off a slower ball! It was full, it was wide, it was tempting and Shakib could not help himself. Leaned into a booming drive and realises he was at the ball way too early. Scoops it up for short cover.

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: top-edge and cover takes a dolly! Mushy cannot believe he has got out so softly. It was slower through the air and pitched on off to tempt a slog sweep. There was just enough turn to make the batsman miscue the shot and Zimbabwe have finally broken through

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman c Chakabva b Kamungozi 4 (10b 1x4 0x6 9m) SR: 40

dismissalComment.html: holes out at deep fine leg! He had to reach out a fair distance in front of him and only manages a top edge that lands in Chakabva's hands

dismissalText.commentary: Abul Hasan c Chigumbura b Mire 1 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: length on off stump and he has hoisted it straight up. It was the slower ball, and he had loaded up for the big shot far too early. Bat face turns in his hands and mid-on collects a simple catch

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Moor b Madziva 39 (25b 4x4 2x6 37m) SR: 156

dismissalComment.html: nicks off to the keeper and Zimbabwe will breathe a sigh of relief. it was a good length ball outside off and Mashrafe was looking to smoke it over cow corner. Ends up outside edging to Moor behind the stumps

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 63 (69b 7x4 0x6 93m) SR: 91.3

dismissalComment.html: gone! It's another bouncer, outside off this time, and he has the width to try and ramp that behind the wicket, but he doesn't really get that much bat on it, and ends up hitting it straight to the keeper

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire c Mahmudullah b Jubair Hossain 52 (54b 6x4 2x6 69m) SR: 96.29

dismissalComment.html: and he's broken the partnership. Tossed it up, and he went for the big drive and maybe didn't quite get to the pitch, ends up hitting it at chest height, straight to Mahmudullah at cover

given! The arm ball does the trick again, as he presses forward to defend and ends up playing down the wrong line. Kept on going with the angle, looked to hit his front pad pretty much right in front. Only doubt may have been because of the angle he's bowling from, so wide of the crease, but the umpire seemed quite sure
bowled him! That was the arm ball again and Masakadza had no clue. Plays a long way away from his body and presents a big gate for the ball to sneak through and crash into the stumps

gone! It's another bouncer, outside off this time, and he has the width to try and ramp that behind the wicket, but he doesn't really get that much bat on it, and ends up hitting it straight to the keeper

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalComment.html: makes room to hit over the off side, ends up going too far away from the length ball outside off. Reaches across to hit it over cover, ends up slicing a high catch to point

dismissalText.commentary: Vusi Sibanda lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 17 (27b 3x4 0x6 42m) SR: 62.96

dismissalComment.html: given! The arm ball does the trick again, as he presses forward to defend and ends up playing down the wrong line. Kept on going with the angle, looked to hit his front pad pretty much right in front. Only doubt may have been because of the angle he's bowling from, so wide of the crease, but the umpire seemed quite sure

dismissalText.commentary: Hamilton Masakadza b Shakib Al Hasan 28 (40b 4x4 0x6 52m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! That was the arm ball again and Masakadza had no clue. Plays a long way away from his body and presents a big gate for the ball to sneak through and crash into the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Timycen Maruma b Jubair Hossain 6 (19b 0x4 0x6 25m) SR: 31.57

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! It's the wrong 'un, and it's surprised Maruma, who went back and across, maybe to punch the ball through the covers. In the end, he brought his bat down hurriedly to try and squeeze it into the on side but it rips off the surface and sneaks between bat and body and clips the off bail. Lovely way to get your first ODI wicket

dismissalText.commentary: Solomon Mire c Mahmudullah b Jubair Hossain 52 (54b 6x4 2x6 69m) SR: 96.29

dismissalComment.html: and he's broken the partnership. Tossed it up, and he went for the big drive and maybe didn't quite get to the pitch, ends up hitting it at chest height, straight to Mahmudullah at cover

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Brendan Taylor c Mushfiqur Rahim b Rubel Hossain 63 (69b 7x4 0x6 93m) SR: 91.3

dismissalComment.html: gone! It's another bouncer, outside off this time, and he has the width to try and ramp that behind the wicket, but he doesn't really get that much bat on it, and ends up hitting it straight to the keeper

dismissalText.long: c Abul Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Abul Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza 4 (14b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: slower ball outside off and he goes for the big hit, away from his body. Wasn't full enough to drive anyway, and he miscues it high in the air, and spoons a simple catch to mid-off

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

image.caption: Regis Chakabva
image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.long: c Jubair Hossain b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva c Jubair Hossain b Rubel Hossain 26 (34b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: makes room to hit over the off side, ends up going too far away from the length ball outside off. Reaches across to hit it over cover, ends up slicing a high catch to point

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor run out (Sabbir Rahman/Mushfiqur Rahim) 13 (25b 1x4 0x6 38m) SR: 52

dismissalComment.html: gone! Pushed it towards point and went for the quick single. Hit it straight to the fielder but the desire to bring Moor on strike was a more pressing factor than the feasibility of the single. Throw came in, keeper whipped the bails off, and Moor was nowhere near his crease

commentTextItems.html: slower ball on leg stump, and Chatara finishes with a six. Simply whips it away, times that so well that it disappears over the boundary to the right of the deep midwicket fielder

commentPostTextItems.html: 8.40pm That's it from all of us. Another big win for Bangladesh, they take a 4-0 lead. Can they make it 5-0, or can Zimbabwe take some of the positives from this game forward and finally win a game on this tour? Be sure to join us for the fifth ODI, and keep sending in your comments. Until then, bye!

8.35pm Presentation time. First up, Elton Chigumbura: "It's always disappointing to lose a game. Taylor and Mire played fantastic, but both went out at the wrong time, just before the powerplay. We had some other positives. The way we bowled at the start, but after four wickets we didn't manage to put more pressure on Mushfiq and Mahmudullah and that's the partnership that took the game away from us. It was a good score to chase down, the way we batted in the middle period, but we lost those two and it's always hard for the guys coming in at six and seven."

Mashrafe Mortaza: "There is no dew, that's why we chose to bat. The way Mahmudullah and Mushfiq batted was brilliant, we came back into the game and the bowlers bowled very well after that. That's my job, to get some runs for the team, and I think I did well today. Jubair is our main bowler, it was his first match and we had to back him. He did well."

Mahmudullah is the man of the match: "The wicket wasn't that good, but Mushy and I did well. He came in and attacked and I was playing the anchor role. We can play the situations now, and that's the important thing, and we are gaining some experience as well."
HDS: "No Arafat Sunny today, so Zimbabwe tail managing to stay till last ball!!!"

Mick: "for the casual score checker they will see result and think this game was a close one but in reality it wasn't close. Zim should of won the game easily from a very dominate position after 30 overs..but alas after the sixth wicket fell so did any chance Zim had of winning. Awful "

8.25pm Bangladesh have won by 21 runs, very comfortably in the end, but Zimbabwe came closer to winning a game than they had at any previous point on this tour. Excellent partnership between Taylor and Mire, but once both were dismissed in quick succession, the game simply meandered to the expected finish.

commentTextItems.html: another slower ball outside off, another slog and miss
down the track, it's another slower ball, and he slogs and misses
down the track, it's the slower ball outside off. Meets it on the full and slaps it to cover
full on off stump, swiped away to deep square leg

commentPreTextItems.html: All Zimbabwe need now are five sixes

commentTextItems.html: slower ball outside off. He makes room initially to swipe over the leg side, and then it turns away from off stump and he just looks at the ball bewildered as it rolls away to the keeper
waist-high full-toss on off stump, slapped to mid-off
down the track, he follows him with the short ball, and he semi-fends, semi-hooks, and mostly periscopes it away to the long-leg boundary
full on middle stump. Makes room and drives straight to mid-off
down the track now, he bowls the slower one outside off, and he clubs it down to long-on
slower bouncer outside off. Makes room first, then tries to reach over and uppercut, can't connect again
short ball, goes for the pull, can't connect
full on the stumps, flicked towards deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, dabbed towards point
loopy delivery wide outside off. Goes for the slog over the leg side, can't connect
skips down the track and he shortens his length a bit, ends up blocking in an ungainly way, back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, swiped towards deep midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor run out (Sabbir Rahman/Mushfiqur Rahim) 13 (25b 1x4 0x6 38m) SR: 52

commentTextItems.html: gone! Pushed it towards point and went for the quick single. Hit it straight to the fielder but the desire to bring Moor on strike was a more pressing factor than the feasibility of the single. Throw came in, keeper whipped the bails off, and Moor was nowhere near his crease
back of a length on off stump, shuffles across and blocks it towards point
slower ball outside off, slapped to point

image.longCaption: Regis Chakabva portrait, World Cup 2011, February 11, 2011

dismissalText.long: c Jubair Hossain b Rubel Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Regis Chakabva c Jubair Hossain b Rubel Hossain 26 (34b 2x4 0x6 62m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: makes room to hit over the off side, ends up going too far away from the length ball outside off. Reaches across to hit it over cover, ends up slicing a high catch to point

dismissalText.long: c Abul Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Abul Hasan b Mashrafe Mortaza 4 (14b 0x4 0x6 19m) SR: 28.57

dismissalComment.html: slower ball outside off and he goes for the big hit, away from his body. Wasn't full enough to drive anyway, and he miscues it high in the air, and spoons a simple catch to mid-off

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor run out (Sabbir Rahman/Mushfiqur Rahim) 13 (25b 1x4 0x6 38m) SR: 52

dismissalComment.html: gone! Pushed it towards point and went for the quick single. Hit it straight to the fielder but the desire to bring Moor on strike was a more pressing factor than the feasibility of the single. Throw came in, keeper whipped the bails off, and Moor was nowhere near his crease

dismissalText.commentary: Neville Madziva not out 3 (4b 0x4 0x6 16m) SR: 75
Tendai Chatara not out 16 (15b 1x4 1x6 12m) SR: 106.66

image.caption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi
image.longCaption: Tafadzwa Kamungozi portrait, Chittagong, World T20, March 10, 2014

dismissalComment.html: slower ball outside off and he goes for the big hit, away from his body. Wasn't full enough to drive anyway, and he miscues it high in the air, and spoons a simple catch to mid-off

given! The arm ball does the trick again, as he presses forward to defend and ends up playing down the wrong line. Kept on going with the angle, looked to hit his front pad pretty much right in front. Only doubt may have been because of the angle he's bowling from, so wide of the crease, but the umpire seemed quite sure
bowled him! That was the arm ball again and Masakadza had no clue. Plays a long way away from his body and presents a big gate for the ball to sneak through and crash into the stumps

gone! It's another bouncer, outside off this time, and he has the width to try and ramp that behind the wicket, but he doesn't really get that much bat on it, and ends up hitting it straight to the keeper

dismissalComment.html: makes room to hit over the off side, ends up going too far away from the length ball outside off. Reaches across to hit it over cover, ends up slicing a high catch to point

headshotImage.caption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Timycen Maruma player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! It's the wrong 'un, and it's surprised Maruma, who went back and across, maybe to punch the ball through the covers. In the end, he brought his bat down hurriedly to try and squeeze it into the on side but it rips off the surface and sneaks between bat and body and clips the off bail. Lovely way to get your first ODI wicket
and he's broken the partnership. Tossed it up, and he went for the big drive and maybe didn't quite get to the pitch, ends up hitting it at chest height, straight to Mahmudullah at cover

Lovely way to get your first ODI wicket

stories.title: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15
stories.subTitle: 4th ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the fourth ODI, Zimbabwe v Bangladesh, 2014-15

stories.title: Zimbabwe fined for slow over rate
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe fined for slow over rate
stories.summary: Zimbabwe captain Elton Chigumbura has been fined 20% of his match fee for a minimum over rate breach of the ICC Code of Conduct during the fourth ODI against Bangladesh in Mirpur

image.caption: Elton Chigumbura resisted with an unbeaten 53
image.longCaption: Elton Chigumbura resisted with an unbeaten 53, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, November 26, 2014

stories.title: 'I don't wish to be a hero' - Mahmudullah
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: 'I don't wish to be a hero' - Mahmudullah
stories.summary: Bangladesh allrounder Mahmudullah admitted that he doesn't really like functioning as the protagonist, and that he was satisfied so long as he could keep contributing to the team

image.caption: Mahmudullah struck a career-best, unbeaten 82
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah struck a career-best, unbeaten 82, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur, November 28, 2014

stories.title: Fifth bowler made the difference - Chigumbura
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Fifth bowler made the difference - Chigumbura
stories.summary: Zimbabwe captain Elton Chigumbura said that the lack of penetration or control from their fifth bowler - comprising four bowlers - made them pay in the fourth ODI in Mirpur

image.caption: Solomon Mire struck his second fifty in three matches
image.longCaption: Solomon Mire struck his second fifty in three matches, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur, November 28, 2014

stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur

image.caption: Mushfiqur Rahim clips the ball into the leg side
image.longCaption: Mushfiqur Rahim clips the ball into the leg side, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur, November 28, 2014

stories.title: Feisty Bangladesh make it 4-0
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: Bangladesh were kept under pressure by Zimbabwe for short periods in both innings, but the hosts were always only a partnership or a wicket away from taking command, and duly went up 4-0 in the five-match series with the 21-run win in Mirpur
stories.byline: The Report by Mohammad Isam in Mirpur

image.caption: Mahmudullah struck a career-best, unbeaten 82
image.longCaption: Mahmudullah struck a career-best, unbeaten 82, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur, November 28, 2014

stories.title: Bangladesh target 4-0 after sealing series
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 4th ODI, Mirpur
stories.summary: With the ODI series secured with two matches to go, Bangladesh can have a tilt at beating Zimbabwe 5-0 or look to preserve their top players ahead of bigger assignments

image.caption: Anamul Haque celebrates his fifty
image.longCaption: Anamul Haque celebrates his fifty, Bangladesh v Zimbabwe, 3rd ODI, Mirpur, November 26, 2014
